titleStmt.title: William Calhoun et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4370

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To. Gov Bramlette
Governor of. Kentucky

The. Undersigned petitioners Would Respectfully Represent that at the September Term of the McLean Circuit Court, a Judgment Was, Obtained against D H Jones for Fifety Dollars. for. Keeping a Tipling House Wee Would Represent, that. Mr. Jones, is a Druggist in the Town, of Calhoon and if he kept. a Tipling it Was Under, Circumstances Such that. We think Executive Clemency Should be used and We Respectfully ask that the fine against mr Jones be Remitted and We Will Ever
Yours truly

W, B Rose
Isaac Vertrees
D T Moseley
Philip, F, Lockett
Azro Dyer
A. H. Edwards
H D, Bassett
C G Clark
James Landrum
Cam,, Moseley
Lot Cooper
S H Jung ELder
